reviews.review_msg: Dr. Pollon will (guaranteed) go on tangents and get really passionate about topics, unrelated or not. He will manage to bring the class back to the topic at hand and will make sure to only test you on what was covered. In the exams we got prompts for topics that have been discussed in class. The criteria is always vague for writing assignments.

Simon is a fun lecturer but he's old school. No notes provided, lectures are off the cuff and written on the blackboard. He is great at engaging with his students and does not shy away from sharing his beliefs or taking shots at those beliefs he doesn't agree with. Exams and assignments are hard. Must attend every lecture. Tough, enjoyable course.

Goes by Dai Heide - probably why it seems like there are no ratings. Very nice guy. Quite funny too when his humour slips out. The class was difficult but great if you like a challenge. The level assignments take a deceptively long time - dont be fooled by word count. Choosing an argument is the hardest part. Would take his classes again.
has strange assignments and does not explain what she is looking for in them, she was okey over all, but I would try to avoid taking another class with her
She is a pretty good professor. The classes can get a little dull at times but they were fine overall. Class was best when people got involved and asked questions.

Kirstie is very nice and sweet. She encourages students to ask questions if they are confused. She can be a little boring, but it's a lot to do with the material, which I wasn't interested in. I found her to be a generous marker. She gave me an A+ on an essay that I would've given myself an A on.

I strongly advise against taking her course. The lectures are a jokeâ€”just pointless student discussions with zero real teaching. The material is hard, and she does nothing to help. It's like she doesn't care if we succeed. If I'd known how useless this class would be, I'd have dropped it immediately.

Professor Wang very clearly puts a lot of thought and effort into facilitating a learning environment that works for her students. This iteration of Phil 203 included a consultative process in the midst of term to rebalance the course fairly to all students and deliver intended learning outcomes. The material covered and assessments are very fair.
Prof Wang is very kind and caring towards students.

I would not recommend other people to take her course. The lectures are just students' discussions and no informative content. The information in the course is challenging, but she does not really help a lot. If I knew this earlier, I would have dropped the course.

She does not help a lot in lectures, they are all student discussions. The lectures and handouts are confusing to understand pretty much because they are all over the place without focus. The prof is there for no reason.

dr. wang is really nice and explains things really clearly during office hours. that being said, her lectures are a little bit hard to pay attention to. there's no real direction, just student participation + her responses. she gives a handout which she'll sometimes refer to but it's really easy to get lose focus because of the lack of organization

Jenn is SO nice, I cannot stress that enough. She really cares about the success of her students. Her class is fair as well as the marking. Though some topics can feel abstract, she is more than willing to review them in more detail, to ensure everyone understands before she moves on.
She's is one of the nicest profs. Sometimes it might be a little difficult to understand her but you can ask her again and again to explain a concept and she would do it.

A great prof! Reviews lecture material often answers any questions and sets you up for success if you submit things by the deadline, and review the readings beforehand. Follow instructions, understand the feedback, and try not to leave things for the last minute. Sidenote: the lectures were very interesting!

Jen is really organized, which I appreciated. She has you keeping on top of your readings by doing a weekly 'critical comment' about them every week, and having discussions within small groups. That being said, her lectures are bland and kind of hard to follow. She makes lecture sheets to guide her and the class but they're pretty overwhelming.
Jennifer made this course very interesting.  She was very fair.  I'd take another course with her.

Most disorganized prof ever. She loses track of what she's talking about and goes off on unrelated tangents regularly. Changes reading assignments and due dates last second and only notifies via email. Honestly, nice person (she brought us cookies on Hallowe'en) but the worst prof I've ever had. At least her class was really easy.

She's a good teacher and she cares about teaching, but students in the class throw her off easily.  Her teaching style is also overheads, but she switches them too fast and it's confusing.  Otherwise, she's great.
she is very focussed on the students and is always willing to help
No Comments
No Comments

she's super helpful if you see her outside of class. her essays are thought-provoking and she's a fair marker.  she takes attendence every class and her essays depend heavily on notes given in class. i think she'll be the one of the more favored profs in a couple of years, she's just fine tuning her teaching skills, but she's got great potential.

She's the departments blonde bombshell, lol. Super nice and friendly. She's new so she looses control of the class from time to time, but she'll get better. She marks fairly and is really lax about dead lines. Her essay topics are also pretty easy, and the amount of reading she assigns is fair.

I've taken at least 3 courses with Martin Hahn, including 203 and 333. His classes are enjoyable because he always makes philosophically interesting and funny commentary when giving examples and such. I love his witty humor! He is a fair marker (not too hard at all), and a nice guy :)
He is super fun and interesting yet I found myself lost half the time. The paper topics were given to late to really do a superb job and the topics had no flair.
Dr.Hahn is a great lecturer and has an awesome sense of humour. The readings are well chosen, and the material is confusing but fascinating.
Hilarious. Has a story for everything.
Funny as hell. Great guy.

This guy talks way to fast while being unclear. How can one grade a student fairly when the midterm is open book and the final is take home? hes unorganized...somewhat **** i think...avoid him at all cause!!!!!!!!and he walks away right at the end of the class so no one can ask him questions...

Holly is an engaging lecturer and has a fair course structure. She also has weekly in-class writings that will keep your understanding in check, so make sure to show up and keep up with readings. Readings are difficult, but she explains the material well. Would definitely take her classes again!

Absolutely loved Holly. Never have I seen a prof so quick to respond  to complicated questions with great answers. Metaphysics is hard, but she has a knack for explanation. Readings are insane, but she goes through them in class. Take TONS of notes, you'll need them for the final. I hope to get her again.

An amazing professor! She is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate, makes the material interesting and makes sure everyone is on board before moving on. It's really necessary to attend lectures because the readings are quite difficult. But she makes everything clear. Short in-class writing assignment every week.

Judging by her early reviews, it seems as though she wasn't especially good in 2011. If this is the case, it is safe to say that she has improved tremendously. Her lectures are interesting, and her examples are both memorable and entertaining. I've had her twice, and I'm sad that I won't be able to have her again; she's the best prof. I've had.
You have to buy the text, she uses it alot. Really interesting extra examples to go along with the text. Weekly writing.
Very good at explaining concepts. Engaging lectures.

Fantastic class! Found the course very challenging but he made it engaging. Seems like a really nice dude. Course was via zoom so never met him in person. Also, email his SFU account else he wont respond (he doesnt check canvas). Hope to take more of his classes in the future. Tests you on things he emphasizes in class. No tricks.
Lectures are great and enjoyable. He's really knowledgable and passionate about what he's teaching.  But be prepared to read papers and write essays.

This is the second PHIL class I've taken with Dr. Heide, and I would take the rest of my PHIL classes with him if I could. He's very clear while making dense content digestible and interesting. His final was comprehensive and fair as well as his grading. Attend all the lectures if you're able to--nothing explains the content better than he can.

Fascinating prof. Listening to his lectures is very enjoyable. He has clear understanding of the materials he's teaching, and is passionate about all these stuff and is really into philosophy . I would never want to miss a single lecture.
Absolutely gifted professor, you will rarely find a professor who is able to explain communicate complex philosophical ideas like he can.

People say he likes to hear himself talk -- I think he's one of the few profs who talks in complete sentences, mind you it may be because of some minor social impairment. Loves his philosophy, genuinely fascinated by physics-based ideas for metaphysics, likes to give a great quote. Too bad he prefers papers that argue what he believes/likes most.

Phil is a great prof. He knows the material, his office door is always open, he is a fair marker and he genuinely likes to read what students write.  A couple of recommendations for doing well: go to class even if he is a bit hard to follow, and talk to him about your paper topic at office hours.  Very intelligent, I have a lot of respect for him.

It's almost impossible to follow him during lecture. His written notes he emails are excellent, but the lecture is useless. He is so all over the place. On the other hand he is a funny guy, and is so very intelligent. Fair marker, and no finals make this class easy.

Borderline genius.  Will make you feel like you ingested too many paint chips as a child.  Always has time to re-explain topics, which is nice although it never ends up being any clearer than the first time you heard it.  Good guy.
He is unbelievably intelligent. But he is a hard marker. But he also challenges you to think, and is willing to help you insofar as you are willing to learn
